verses.text: 道成肉身太初有道，道與　神同在，道就是　神。

words.note: A theological concept referring to the incarnation of Christ.

words.definition: in the beginning, at the very first
words.note: Specifically refers to the absolute beginning in Genesis/John.
Refers to the pre-existent Christ in John 1; often capitalized as 'the Word' in English.
Used to refer to the singular God of the Bible, often capitalized as 'God' in English.

verses.text: 這道太初與　神同在。
萬有是藉著他造的；凡被造的，沒有一樣不是藉著他造的。

words.note: Refers to the Word/Christ.
Used here to turn a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which was created by him'.

words.definition: that which was created, be created

verses.text: 在他裡面有生命，（有些抄本第3、4節或譯：「萬有是藉著他造的，沒有一樣不是藉著他造的；凡被造的，都在他裡面有生命……」）這生命就是人的光。

words.note: Measure word for chapters and verses in scripture.

words.definition: that which was created, be created

verses.text: 光照在黑暗中，黑暗不能勝過光。

words.note: Suffix indicating location or state.
Modal verb.

verses.text: 有一個人，名叫約翰，是　神所差來的。

words.note: Combines numeral and measure word.
The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence in CUV.
Forms a nominalizer/passive structure with following verb.
Verb-complement structure meaning 'sent forth'.
Nominalizes '所差來', meaning 'the one who was sent'.

verses.text: 他來是要作見證，就是為光作見證，使眾人藉著他可以相信。

words.definition: to want to, be going to
words.note: Indicates intention or purpose.
Refers to spiritual light, personified in John 1.

verses.text: 他不是那光，而是要為那光作見證。

words.note: Used as a demonstrative pronoun to refer to 'the light'.
Refers to spiritual light, personified in John 1.
Often used with '是' to mean 'but rather'.

words.definition: to want to, be going to
words.note: Indicates intention or purpose.
Used as a demonstrative pronoun to refer to 'the light'.
Refers to spiritual light, personified in John 1.

verses.text: 那光來到世界，是普照世人的真光。

words.note: Used as a demonstrative pronoun to refer to 'the light'.
Refers to spiritual light, personified in John 1.
Functions as a verb complement indicating arrival.
Indicates 'the light that shines on mankind'.

verses.text: 他在世界，世界也是藉著他造的，世界卻不認識他。

words.note: Refers to creation by God.
Nominalizes '藉著他造', meaning 'that which was created by him'.

verses.text: 他到自己的地方來，自己的人卻不接受他。
凡接受他的，就是信他名的人，他就賜給他們權利，成為　神的兒女。

words.note: A formal term for giving, often from a superior.
Refers to both sons and daughters.

verses.text: 他們不是從血統生的，不是從肉身的意思生的，也不是從人意生的，而是從　神生的。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to carnal desire or human will.

verses.text: 道成了肉身，住在我們中間，滿有恩典和真理。我們見過他的榮光，正是從父而來的獨生子的榮光。

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ, the divine Word.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Refers to God the Father.
Literally 'and come', indicating origin.

verses.text: 約翰為他作見證，大聲說：「這一位就是我所說的：『那在我以後來的，位分比我高，因為他本來是在我以前的。』」
從他的豐盛裡我們都領受了，而且恩上加恩。

words.note: Refers to spiritual or divine abundance.
Often used for receiving spiritual gifts or blessings.

verses.text: 律法是藉著摩西頒布的，恩典和真理卻是藉著耶穌基督而來的。

words.note: Refers to the Mosaic Law.
Often used for official decrees or laws.
Compound word for 'grace'.
Indicates something comes as a result or by means of something else.

verses.text: 從來沒有人見過　神，只有在父懷裡的獨生子把他彰顯出來。

words.note: Always used with a negative verb, e.g., '從來沒有'.
The preceding space is a traditional respectful rendering for God in some Chinese Bibles.
Refers to God the Father.
A theological term referring to Jesus Christ.
Verb complement indicating emergence or revelation.

verses.text: 施洗約翰的見證（太3:1~12；可1:1~8；路3:1~18）以下是約翰的見證：猶太人從耶路撒冷派祭司和利未人到約翰那裡，問他：「你是誰？」

words.note: Abbreviation for Gospel of Matthew.
Abbreviation for Gospel of Mark.
Abbreviation for Gospel of Luke.
Religious official who performs rituals and sacrifices.
Members of the tribe of Levi, serving in the temple.

verses.text: 約翰並不否認，坦白地承認說：「我不是基督。」

words.note: Used before a negative to intensify the negation.

verses.text: 他們又問：「那麼你是誰？是以利亞嗎？」他說：「我不是。」「是那位先知嗎？」他回答：「不是。」
於是他們再問：「你是誰？好讓我們回覆派我們來的人。你說你自己是誰？」
他說：「我就是在曠野呼喊者的聲音：『修直主的路！』正如以賽亞先知所說的。」
這些人是法利賽人派來的。
他們問約翰：「你既然不是基督，不是以利亞，也不是那位先知，那麼你為甚麼施洗呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'anointed one', refers to Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 約翰回答：「我是用水施洗，但有一位站在你們中間，是你們不認識的；

words.note: Lit. 'bestow washing'

verses.text: 他是在我以後來的，我就是給他解鞋帶也不配。」

words.note: Used here for emphasis: 'even if...'
Used with 就 for emphasis: 'even if'

verses.text: 這些事發生在約旦河東的伯大尼，約翰施洗的地方。
神的羊羔第二天，約翰見耶穌迎面而來，就說：「看哪，　神的羊羔，是除去世人的罪孽的！

words.note: Often capitalized in translation, referring to the Abrahamic God.
Describes coming directly towards someone.
An interjection used for drawing attention, common in biblical texts.
Often carries a theological sense of humanity apart from God.
Specifically refers to moral or religious wrongdoing.

verses.text: 這一位就是我所說的：『有一個人，是在我以後來的，位分比我高，因為他本來是在我以前的。』

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb.
More formal or biblical than modern '地位'.

verses.text: 我本來不認識他，但為了要把他顯明給以色列人，因此我來用水施洗。」
約翰又作見證說：「我曾看見聖靈，好像鴿子從天上降下來，停留在他的身上。

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit, the third person of the Trinity.

verses.text: 我本來不認識他，但那差我來用水施洗的對我說：『你看見聖靈降下來，停留在誰身上，誰就是用聖靈施洗的。』

words.note: Here, it nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'the one who sent me...'
Refers to the Holy Spirit, the third person of the Trinity.
Refers to the Holy Spirit, the third person of the Trinity.
Here, it nominalizes the preceding phrase, meaning 'the one who baptizes...'

verses.text: 我看見了，就作見證說：『這就是　神的兒子。』」

words.note: Indicates completion or a new situation.

verses.text: 呼召第一批門徒（太4:18~22；可1:16~20；路5:2~11）過了一天，約翰和他的兩個門徒又站在那裡。

words.note: Abbreviation for the Gospel of Matthew.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Mark.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Luke.
Indicates completion or a new situation.

verses.text: 約翰看見耶穌走過的時候，就說：「看哪，　神的羊羔！」

words.note: A common biblical exclamation.
Often used metaphorically for Christ in the Bible.

verses.text: 那兩個門徒聽見他的話，就跟從了耶穌。
耶穌轉過身來，看見他們跟著，就問：「你們要甚麼？」他們說：「拉比，你在哪裡住？」（「拉比」的意思就是「老師」。）

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew 'rabbi', meaning teacher.
Explaining the meaning of 'Rabbi'.

verses.text: 他說：「你們來看吧！」於是他們就去看他所住的地方。那一天他們就和耶穌住在一起；那時大約是下午四點鐘。

words.note: Indicates the following verb is part of a noun phrase.

verses.text: 聽了約翰的話而跟從耶穌的那兩個人，一個是西門．彼得的弟弟安得烈。
他先找到自己的哥哥西門，告訴他：「我們遇見彌賽亞了！」（「彌賽亞」的意思就是「基督」。）

words.note: Resultative complement indicating successful completion.

words.definition: indicates completion or change of state

verses.text: 安得烈就帶他到耶穌那裡。耶穌定睛看著他，說：「你是約翰的兒子西門，你要稱為磯法。」（「磯法」翻譯出來就是「彼得」。）

words.note: A directional complement indicating outward movement or revelation.

verses.text: 呼召腓力和拿但業再過一天，耶穌決定往加利利去；他遇見腓力，就對他說：「來跟從我！」

words.note: Often refers to a divine calling in biblical context.

verses.text: 腓力是伯賽大人，與安得烈和彼得同鄉。
腓力找到拿但業，告訴他：「摩西在律法書上所寫的，和眾先知所記的那位，我們已經遇見了，他就是約瑟的兒子拿撒勒人耶穌。」

words.note: Resultative complement indicating successful completion.
Refers to the Pentateuch or Mosaic Law.
Used as a postposition to indicate location within a text.

words.definition: particle indicating agent or passive voice
words.note: Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, often translated as 'that which'.
Lit. 'one who knows first' or 'one who knows before (others)'.

words.definition: particle indicating agent or passive voice
words.note: Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, often translated as 'that which'.

words.definition: indicates completion or change of state

verses.text: 拿但業說：「拿撒勒還能出甚麼好的嗎？」腓力說：「你來看！」

words.note: Combined with 來 forms 'come and see'.

verses.text: 耶穌看見拿但業向他走過來，就論到他說：「看哪，這的確是個以色列人，他心裡沒有詭詐。」

words.note: Directional complement indicating movement towards the speaker.
Means 'to talk about, concerning'.
Used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Short for 一個 (yī gè).
Literally 'Israel person'.
A more formal or literary term for deception.

verses.text: 拿但業問他：「你怎麼認識我呢？」耶穌回答：「腓力還沒有招呼你，你在無花果樹下的時候，我就看見你了。」

words.note: Literally 'flowerless fruit tree', referring to the fig's inconspicuous flowers.

verses.text: 拿但業說：「拉比，你是　神的兒子，你是以色列的王！」

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew word for 'my master' or 'teacher'.
The elevated empty space often denotes reverence for 'God' in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「因為我告訴你『我看見你在無花果樹下』，你就信了嗎？你還要看見比這些更大的事。」

words.note: Combines with preceding adjective to form an adjectival phrase modifying the noun.

verses.text: 又對他說：「我實實在在告訴你們，你們要看見天開了，　神的眾使者在人子的身上，上去下來。」

words.note: Emphatic reduplication of 'true, real'.
Elevated character for reverence, referring to the Christian God.
In biblical context, often refers to angels.
A title for Jesus in the Bible.
